intro: Tragia delpyana, commonly known as the Brazilian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture. Tragia delpyana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions.
